conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway 3D view: walls have height/thickness, multiple faces are visible, and the camera is angled with the ceiling removed to expose interior volume.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion with readable wall corners and clear floor-vs-wall separation; cutaway is mostly clean with minor simplification/occlusion at some edges.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall massing resembles the 2D plan (central living/dining with bedroom wings), but several internal partitions/room proportions appear simplified and some adjacency/opening placements do not clearly match the 2D drawing (bath/utility/kitchen zone and bedroom cluster details are hard to reconcile precisely).

interior_elements.notes: Basic furniture blocks (beds/tables/sofa-like pieces) are present, but kitchen and bathroom fixtures are largely missing or not clearly identifiable; furniture-room assignment is only partially verifiable.

visual_clarity.notes: Geometry is readable with adequate lighting and contrast; however, faint embedded plan text/markings on surfaces reduce presentation cleanliness.

detected_errors.description: Noticeable simplification/distortion of internal partition geometry and some room proportions compared to the 2D plan, especially around service/bathroom/kitchen and bedroom subdivision.
Doors/windows/openings are simplified; several exact placements and sizes cannot be confirmed to match the 2D plan.
Kitchen/bath fixtures are not clearly modeled; furniture set is incomplete relative to the 2D plan program.
Faint text/plan markings appear on 3D surfaces, reducing presentation cleanliness.

summary: A genuine cutaway 3D conversion with good volumetric readability, but with moderate plan-fidelity issues in partitions/openings and simplified or missing interior fixtures.
